summary.title: Project Overview
summary.mainSummary: This project focused on simplifying a cluttered job results page and improving the search and filtering experience. The original layout was overwhelming, and users struggled with fragmented navigation, particularly on mobile. As the lead designer, I aimed to modernize the page by prioritizing job listings, streamlining filters, and improving mobile functionality. The solution involved transitioning to a single-column job card layout, creating a clearer visual hierarchy, and refining the search and filter experience. We added strategic callouts like top-matching jobs and premium ads, ensuring a more cohesive and engaging experience. These changes led to improved user focus and engagement across both desktop and mobile platforms.

overviewPoints.pointPara: Modernise the job results page by prioritising clarity, usability, and engagement. Ensure users can easily scan job listings, adjust filters, and discover relevant content, all in a responsive, mobile-first environment.

The previous layout was overwhelming, with cluttered content above the fold and fragmented search/filter workflows. Two-column job cards made it hard for listings to stand out, and value-added content like premium ads and career tools was often overlooked. The challenge was to create a clear visual hierarchy and seamless cross-device experience without sacrificing utility or engagement opportunities.

evaluateEnhance.title: Evaluate & Enhance
evaluateEnhanceSummary: The redesign focused on reducing clutter, improving content hierarchy, and consolidating search and filter interactions. A split layout with job results on the left and filters/tools on the right created a clear reading flow, while strategic callouts—such as top-matching jobs, premium ads, and promotional tools—were integrated without disrupting the experience. Mobile interactions were carefully refined to minimise taps, maintain context, and ensure consistent visual appeal. These enhancements improved user focus, reduced cognitive load, and created a more conversion-friendly experience across devices.

outcome.title: The Outcome
outcomeSummary: The redesigned job results page delivered a cleaner, more intuitive experience across desktop and mobile. Job listings are more readable, filters are consolidated into a single-step process, and value-added content is strategically highlighted without disrupting flow. Users can now focus on their search while easily accessing top jobs, premium ads, and career tools. Positive feedback highlighted the improved visual hierarchy, reduced friction, and enhanced mobile experience. The split layout and mobile-first design also provide a scalable framework for future iterations, ensuring the platform remains efficient, engaging, and user-centric.

summary.title: Project Overview
summary.mainSummary: The Job Details Page was redesigned to improve clarity, engagement, and conversion for jobseekers. The previous layout was functional but lacked modern visual appeal, and mobile users faced friction due to duplicated CTAs and convoluted job alert sign-ups. The redesign focused on streamlining interactions, improving hierarchy, and adding intuitive features like a top search bar and a single-step email sign-up form.

overviewPoints.pointPara: Modernise the job details page to enhance usability, engagement, and conversion. Ensure jobseekers can easily scan critical information, apply for roles, sign up for alerts, and explore similar jobs—all in a mobile-first, visually clean layout.

The original page suffered from redundancy on mobile, unclear content hierarchy, and underutilised engagement tools like email sign-ups and “Similar Jobs.” The challenge was to simplify and modernise the layout while keeping all functionality accessible and intuitive across devices.

evaluateEnhance.title: Evaluate & Enhance
evaluateEnhanceSummary: The redesign focused on creating a cleaner, more conversion-optimised page. Key changes included removing duplicate CTAs on mobile, adding a one-step email sign-up form above the “Similar Jobs” section, and improving the layout hierarchy with a “Key Facts” summary at the top. A persistent top search bar was also introduced to guide users toward additional opportunities, increasing engagement and reducing friction. These enhancements made the page more usable, visually appealing, and effective at converting visits into applications or sign-ups.

points.sectionPara: Experiment top vs bottom CTA positions and in-line email form placement to optimise click-through and scroll depth.

Allow users to customise alert preferences or receive role-specific notifications.

outcome.title: The Outcome
outcomeSummary: The Job Details Page redesign delivered a modern, mobile-first experience that streamlined user interactions and improved engagement. Redundant CTAs were removed, a single-step email sign-up simplified job alert subscriptions, and a “Key Facts” summary at the top enhanced content readability. The “Similar Jobs” section was reorganised for clarity and relevance, and the top search bar allowed users to quickly explore other roles. Overall, the page became visually cleaner, easier to navigate, and more conversion-focused, balancing usability, engagement, and a seamless experience across devices.

summary.title: Project Overview
summary.mainSummary: Company Pages was redesigned to allow employers to showcase their brand, culture, and open roles in a visually engaging and flexible way. The goal was to transform a generic, uninspiring layout into a modular, brand-rich experience while keeping the broader platform familiar and navigable for jobseekers.

overviewPoints.pointPara: Redesign company pages to give each employer a unique, customizable presence that reflects their brand identity and highlights key content such as culture, values, employee stories, and job listings. Improve the jobseeker experience by making company exploration more engaging and intuitive.

The previous pages were cluttered, uninspiring, and offered minimal differentiation. Generic layouts and slow-loading results pages especially hurt mobile experiences. The challenge was to create flexible templates and modular components that allowed companies to express their uniqueness while maintaining a scalable, consistent framework across the platform.

summary.title: Project Overview
summary.mainSummary: Industry Job Platforms is a suite of industry-specific job boards, each with a unique visual identity but built on a shared HTML structure. The project aimed to provide partners with tailored platforms for different job sectors while maintaining scalability, efficiency, and a consistent user experience across all sites.

overviewPoints.pointPara: Design and develop multiple niche job sites with distinct branding while using a unified HTML foundation to reduce code redundancy. Each site needed to be visually appealing, responsive, SEO-friendly, and easy to maintain and scale for new industries.

Balancing uniqueness and consistency was the main challenge. Each Industry Job Platforms required its own branding, icons, and colour palette, but the underlying structure and UX had to remain consistent. The project also demanded a scalable front-end approach to ensure future sites could be launched quickly without repeating development work.

validationNextSteps.title: Validation & Next Steps
validationSummary: Early planning focused on creating a flexible, reusable system that could adapt to different industries without compromising UX or performance. Wireframes, prototypes, and style guides were used to validate layouts, navigation, and visual hierarchy for each Industry Job Platform, ensuring consistency and clarity across the suite. Concept diagrams and layout prototypes helped test responsive behaviour and content structure before full development, while shared HTML and CSS frameworks were designed for scalability, allowing new sites to be rolled out efficiently. Post-launch validation is planned to track user engagement, navigation patterns, and site-specific SEO performance to guide future optimisations.

summary.title: Project Overview
summary.mainSummary: MyJobDNA is an interactive platform designed to help users discover their ideal career paths through a personality-based quiz. Users receive a unique 3-letter DNA code that corresponds to curated job recommendations, helping them explore careers in a fun, personalised, and engaging way. The platform combines quiz logic, user dashboards, and downloadable certificates, all built to be mobile-friendly, visually appealing, and connected to TheBIGJobsite's job listings.

overviewPoints.pointPara: Design and develop an interactive web platform that guides users toward ideal career paths through a personality-based quiz. The platform needed to be engaging, intuitive, and fully responsive, offering personalised MyJobDNA results, curated job recommendations, and downloadable certificates—all while connecting seamlessly to TheBIGJobsite.

Building a fun, accurate, and scalable quiz experience from scratch presented both UX and technical challenges. Key hurdles included designing an intuitive quiz flow, generating meaningful DNA results, creating a dashboard for logged-in users, and integrating certificates and job data in a way that maintained speed, responsiveness, and clarity across devices.

validationNextSteps.title: Validation & Next Steps
validationSummary: Before launch, the platform was designed with validation and scalability in mind. Early concept mapping and UX flows ensured the quiz experience was intuitive, the DNA logic accurate, and the dashboard interactions clear, providing a solid foundation for real user testing and ongoing optimisation. Early experience mapping helped validate the end-to-end journey—from quiz entry to DNA result and dashboard interactions—ensuring smooth navigation and logical handoffs. The modular component structure, built with the Next.js framework, supports scalable updates and future feature expansions. Planned usability testing will measure quiz completion, result engagement, and job click-through rates across diverse user groups to guide continuous improvement.

improvements.title: Future Enhancements
improvements.mainSummary: The MyJobDNA platform is built to grow, and several enhancements are planned to deepen user engagement, refine results, and expand functionality. These improvements focus on personalised career guidance, interactive dashboards, and sharing capabilities while maintaining a clean, responsive experience.

points.sectionPara: Expand DNA logic to include more granular personality traits and refined job-matching rules.
Introduce saved results and historical tracking so users can revisit recommendations over time.
Enhance dashboards with skill progression insights, learning resources, and career planning tools.
Enable social sharing of results and certificates to increase engagement and reach.
Scale job data integrations and add new features as user needs evolve.

outcome.title: The Outcome
outcomeSummary: The MyJobDNA platform successfully delivered a fully responsive, mobile-first experience that guides users through a personality-based quiz to discover career paths. Users receive unique DNA codes linked to curated job recommendations and can access a personalised dashboard to track their results and download certificates. Custom branding, illustrations, and interactive components created an engaging experience, while a modular React/Next.js framework ensured scalability and future feature expansion. By integrating directly with TheBIGJobsite, the platform connects users to live job listings, offering a seamless, intuitive, and launch-ready career exploration tool.
